title: Import io Module
description: Import the io module and verify it has the 'BytesIO' class.
hints: io module provides Python's main I/O facilities

title: Create a StringIO Object
description: Import StringIO from io and create a StringIO object named 'sio'.

title: Write to StringIO
description: Create a StringIO object, write 'Hello, World!' to it, then get the value. Store the string in 'output'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO, write to it, get value

title: Read from StringIO
description: Create a StringIO with initial content 'Python IO', then read all content into 'content'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO with initial content and read it

title: Seek in StringIO
description: Create a StringIO with 'abcdefgh', seek to position 3, read the rest, and store in 'result'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO, seek to position 3, read rest
hints: Use .read() to read from current position

title: Create a BytesIO Object
description: Import BytesIO from io and create a BytesIO object named 'bio'.

title: Write Bytes to BytesIO
description: Create a BytesIO object, write b'Hello' to it, then get the bytes value. Store in 'output'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO, write bytes, get value

title: Read from BytesIO
description: Create a BytesIO with initial bytes b'Python', then read all bytes into 'data'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO with initial bytes and read it

title: Read Specific Number of Bytes
description: Create a BytesIO with b'0123456789', read exactly 5 bytes, and store in 'chunk'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO and read 5 bytes

title: Get Current Position with tell()
description: Create a StringIO with 'test', read 2 characters, then use tell() to get current position. Store in 'position'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO, read 2 chars, get position

title: Seek to End of Stream
description: Create a BytesIO with b'data', seek to the end using seek(0, 2), then write b'more'. Store final bytes in 'result'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO, seek to end, write more

title: Read Line from StringIO
description: Create a StringIO with 'line1\nline2\nline3', read the first line using readline(), store in 'first_line'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO with multiple lines, read first line

title: Read All Lines from StringIO
description: Create a StringIO with 'a\nb\nc', use readlines() to get all lines as a list. Store in 'lines'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO and use readlines()
hints: Use .readlines() to get list of lines

title: Truncate Stream
description: Create a BytesIO with b'1234567890', seek to position 5, truncate, then get value. Store in 'result'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO, seek to 5, truncate
hints: truncate() removes everything after current position

title: Use StringIO with Context Manager
description: Use StringIO as a context manager (with statement), write 'context' to it, and store getvalue() in 'result'.
starterCode: # Use StringIO with 'with' statement
hints: Get value before with block ends

title: Check if Stream is Writable
description: Create a StringIO and check if it's writable using the writable() method. Store result in 'is_writable'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO and check if writable

title: Check if Stream is Readable
description: Create a BytesIO with b'test' and check if it's readable using the readable() method. Store in 'is_readable'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO and check if readable

title: Check if Stream is Seekable
description: Create a StringIO and check if it's seekable using the seekable() method. Store in 'can_seek'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO and check if seekable

title: Check if Stream is Closed
description: Create a BytesIO, close it, then check the 'closed' attribute. Store in 'is_closed'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO, close it, check closed attribute

title: Convert Between String and Bytes IO
description: Create a StringIO with 'hello', encode to bytes, write to BytesIO, then get the bytes value. Store in 'result'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO, get string, encode, write to BytesIO
hints: Use .encode() to convert string to bytes

title: Write Multiple Times
description: Create a StringIO, write 'Hello', then write ' World', then get the complete value. Store in 'message'.
starterCode: # Write multiple times to StringIO
hints: Use getvalue() to get complete string

title: Get BytesIO Buffer
description: Create a BytesIO with b'buffer', get a memoryview of its buffer using getbuffer(), and store length in 'buffer_len'.
starterCode: # Create BytesIO and get buffer length

title: Use BytesIO as File-like Object
description: Create a BytesIO with b'1,2,3\n4,5,6', pass it to a csv reader (already imported), and count rows. Store in 'row_count'.
setupCode:
from io import BytesIO, TextIOWrapper
import csv
starterCode: # Create BytesIO, wrap in TextIOWrapper, use csv.reader
hints: Pass to csv.reader() and count rows

title: Create StringIO with Initial Value
description: Create a StringIO with initial value 'initial', seek to end, write ' added', get value. Store in 'final'.
starterCode: # Create StringIO with initial value, append to it
